checkpoint.name: PHC maintains records, as required under the Biomedical Waste Rules 2016
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check following records -
a. Yearly Health Check-up record of all handlers
b. BMW training records of all staff (once in year training)
c. Immunisation records of all waste handlers

checkpoint.name: PHC has a valid authorization for Bio Medical waste Management from the prescribed authority
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the validity of authorization certificate

checkpoint.name: PHC submits Annual report to pollution control board
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the records that reports have been submitted to the prescribed authority on or before 30th June every year.

checkpoint.name: Disposal of Expired or discarded medicine
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Returned back to manufacturer or supplier
Alternatively handed over to CWTF Operator for incineration at temperature > 12000C

checkpoint.name: Availability of Mercury Spill Management Kit and Staff is aware of Mercury Spill management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Mercury Spill Management Kit and ask staff what he/she would do in case of Mercury spill. (If facility is mercury free give full compliance)

checkpoint.name: Disposal of used Disinfectant solution like Glutaraldehyde
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: System of pre-treatment before

checkpoint.name: Hand-washing facilities have been provided for patients, handing-over Urine Samples
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of soap & water for patients, who are handing-over Urine samples in the laboratory

checkpoint.name: Liquid waste is made safe before mixing with other waste water
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the procedure - staff interview and direct observation

checkpoint.name: The laboratory has a functional protocol for managing discarded samples
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: A copy of such protocol should be available and staff should be aware of the same.

checkpoint.name: Facility measures the Health care associated infections
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for monitoring of Healthcare Associated Infection that may occur in a Primary healthcare setting like Injection abscess, Postpartum sepsis, infection at dressing and suturing sites etc.

checkpoint.name: Regular Monitoring of infection control practices
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if there is any practice of daily monitoring of infection control practice like hand hygiene and personal protection

checkpoint.name: Facility reports all notifiable diseases and events
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that the facility has list of all notifiable disease needs immediate/periodic reporting to higher authority.
Check records that notifiable disease have been reported in program such as IDSP and AEFI Surveillance.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Sink and running water at point of use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for washbasin with functional tap, soap and running water at all points of use

checkpoint.name: Display of Hand washing Instructions
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that Hand washing instructions are displayed preferably at all points of use

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of standard hand washing protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask facility staff to demonstrate 6 steps of normal hand wash and 5 moments of hand washing

checkpoint.name: Correct method of wearing and removing PPEs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the staff to demonstrate correct method of wearing and removing Gloves, caps and masks etc.

checkpoint.name: The staff is aware of use of gloves, when to use (occasion) and its type
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with the staff when do they wear gloves, and when gloves are not required. The Staff should also know difference between clean & sterilized gloves and when to use

checkpoint.name: No re-use of disposable personal protective equipment
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that disposable gloves and mask are not re-used. Reusable Gloves and mask are used after adequate sterilization.

checkpoint.name: Decontamination and cleaning of instruments after use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check whether instruments are decontaminated with 0.5% chlorine solution for 10 minutes. Check instruments are cleaned thoroughly with water and soap before sterilization

checkpoint.name: Decontamination of operating and Surface examination table, dressing tables etc. after every procedures
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff when and how they clean the operating surfaces either by chlorine solution or Disinfectant like carbolic acid

checkpoint.name: Staff knows how to make Chlorine solution
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the staff how to make 1% chlorine solution from Bleaching powder and Hypochlorite solution

checkpoint.name: Infectious patients are not mixed for general patients
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check infectious patients are separated from other patients

checkpoint.name: Restriction of external foot wear in critical areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: External foot wear are not allowed in labour room, OT etc.( As Applicable)

checkpoint.name: Maintenance of adequate bed to bed distance in wards
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: A distance of 3.5 Foot is maintained between two beds in wards

checkpoint.name: Use of Heavy Duty Gloves and gumboot by waste handlers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the housekeeping staff and waste handlers are using heavy duty gloves and gum boots

checkpoint.name: Use of Gloves during procedures and examination
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the staff uses gloves during examination, and while conducting procedures

checkpoint.name: Use of Masks ,Head cap and Lab coat, Apron etc.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if staff uses mask head caps , Lab coat and aprons in patient care and procedure areas

checkpoint.name: Antibiotic Policy is implemented at the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if the PHC has documented Anti biotic policy and doctors are aware of it.

checkpoint.name: Infection Control Committee is constituted and functional in the PHC
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the enabling order and minutes of the meeting

checkpoint.name: Immunization and medical check-up of Service Providers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
PHC staff has been immunized against Hepatitis B
Check for the records and lab investigations of staff

checkpoint.name: Spill management protocols are displayed at points if use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for display

checkpoint.name: Availability of spill management Kit
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of kits

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of how to manage spills
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for adherence to protocols

checkpoint.name: Preventive measures for air borne infections has been taken
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff is aware, adhere and promote respiratory hygiene and cough etiquettes

checkpoint.name: Adequate number of Air-exchange in Laboratory
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Please check availability and serviceability of exhaust fan in the laboratory

checkpoint.name: Cross-ventilation at Patient Care areas (ward, labour room and dressing room)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of Fans/ air conditioning/ Heating/ exhaust/ Ventilators as per environment condition and requirement

checkpoint.name: Adherence to Protocols for sterilization
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check about awareness of recommended temperature, duration and pressure for autoclaving instruments - 121 degree C, 15 Pound Pressure for 20 Minutes (30 Minutes if wrapped) Linen - 121 C, 15 Pound for 30 Minutes.
Check if the staff know the protocol for sterilization of laparoscope soaking it in 2% Glutaraldehyde solution for 10 Hours

checkpoint.name: Adherence to Protocol for High Level disinfection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with the staff process about of High Level disinfection using Boiling for 20 minutes with lid on, soaking in 2% Glutaraldehyde/Chlorine solution for 20 minutes.

checkpoint.name: Use of autoclave tape for monitoring of sterilization
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check autoclaving records for use of sterilization indicators (signal Lock)

checkpoint.name: Cold storage equipment's are clean and managed properly
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check ILR, Deep freezers and Ice packs are clean
Check there is a practice of regular cleaning.
Check vaccines are kept in sequence
Check work instruction for storage of vaccines are displayed at point of use

checkpoint.name: Cold storage equipment are not used for storing other items, than vaccine .
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check eatables are not kept in ILR/Deep Freezers

checkpoint.name: Medicines are arranged systematically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check all the shelves/racks containing medicines are labelled in pharmacy and drug store
Heavy items are stored at lower shelves/racks
Fragile items are not stored at the edges of the shelves
Drugs and consumables are stored away from water and sources of heat, direct sunlight etc.
Drugs are not stored at floor and adjacent to wall

checkpoint.name: Drinking Water is tested and chlorinated
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Presence of free chlorine at 0.2 ppm is tested in the samples drawn at the consumer's end.

checkpoint.name: The facility receives adequate quantity of water as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: At least 200 litres of water per bed per day is available (if municipal supply). or the water is available on 24x7 basis at all points of usage

checkpoint.name: There is storage tank for the water and tank is cleaned periodically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: The PHC should have capacity to store 48 hours water requirement Water tank is cleaned at six monthly interval and records are maintained.

checkpoint.name: Bed-sheets and pillow cover are stain free and clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observe the condition of linen in use in the wards and other patient care area

checkpoint.name: The facility has adequate stock (including reserve) of linen
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the stock position and its turn-over during last one year in term of demand and availability

checkpoint.name: Bed-sheets and linen are changed daily
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the bedsheets and pillow cover have been changed daily. Please interview the patients as well.

checkpoint.name: Medical officers monitor cleanliness and hygiene of outreach sessions and sub centres.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with medical officers and records of monthly meeting ''Swachh Baharat Abhiyan'' has been followed up during monthly meetings with extension workers like MPW, ASHA, ANM etc.

checkpoint.name: ASHA's are promoting cleanliness and hygiene practices
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for ASHA's counsel mothers for hand hygiene, toilets, water sanitation etc.

checkpoint.name: Biomedical waste generated during outreach session are transported to the PHC on the same day
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the records and ask staff

checkpoint.name: Security personal reprimands attendants, who found indulging into unhygienic behaviour - spitting, open field urination & defecation, etc.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if security personnel watch behaviour of patients and their attendants, particularly in respect of hygiene, sanitation, etc. and take appropriate actions, as deemed.

checkpoint.name: Departments are locked after working hours
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Departments like OPD, Lab, Administrative office etc. are locked after working hours.

checkpoint.name: One Security Guard per shift
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the presence of one security personnel at PHC every shift

checkpoint.name: Bio medical waste Management training has been provided to the staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with the training records

checkpoint.name: PHC has documented Standard Operating procedures for Cleanliness, Bio-Medical waste management and Infection Control
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of SOP with respective users

checkpoint.name: Infection control Training has been provided to the staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff are trained at the time of induction and once in every year

checkpoint.name: Cleanliness and infection control committee has representation of all cadre of staff including Group D and cleanings staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with the records

checkpoint.name: Roles and responsibility of different staff members have been assigned and communicated
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask different members about their roles and responsibilities

checkpoint.name: PHC leadership review the progress of the cleanliness drive on weekly basis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check about regularity of meetings and monitoring activities regarding cleanliness drive

checkpoint.name: The Health facility has a system to take feed-back from patients and visitors for maintaining the cleanliness of the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if there is a feedback system for the patients. Verify the records

checkpoint.name: Local community and organisations are involved in monitoring and promoting cleanliness
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Members of RKS and Local Governance bodies monitor the cleanliness of the PHC at pre-defined intervals
Local NGO/ Civil Society Organizations/Panchayati Raj Institution are involved in cleanliness of the PHC

checkpoint.name: Patients are made aware of their responsibility of keeping the health facility clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask patients about their roles& responsibilities with regards to cleanliness. Patients responsibilities should be prominently displayed

checkpoint.name: IEC regarding importance of maintaining hand hygiene is displayed in PHC premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Should be displayed prominently in local language

checkpoint.name: IEC regarding use of toilets is displayed within PHC premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Should be displayed prominently in local language

checkpoint.name: IEC regarding Swachhta Abhiyan is displayed within the facilities premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Should be displayed prominently in local language

checkpoint.name: PHC has dress code policy for all cadre of staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: PHCs staff adhere to dress code

checkpoint.name: There is a regular monitoring of hygiene of staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check about personal hygiene and clean dress of staff

checkpoint.name: Identity cards and name plates have been provided to all staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff uses I Card and name plate

checkpoint.name: Use of energy efficient bulbs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that PHC uses energy efficient bulb like CFL or LED for lighting purpose within the PHC Premises

checkpoint.name: Adequate illumination in inside and outside of the PHC area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check for Adequate lighting arrangements through Natural Light or Electric Bulbs inside PHC
Check that PHC front, entry gate and access road are well illuminated

checkpoint.name: No water logging in open areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for water accumulation in open areas because of faulty drainage, leakage from the pipes, etc.

checkpoint.name: There is no abandoned / dilapidated building / unused structure within the premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for presence of any abandoned building and unused temporary structure within the premises

checkpoint.name: No junk material within PHC premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if unused/ condemned articles, and outdated records are kept in the Nursing stations, OPD clinics, Labour Room , Injection Room , Dressing Room, Wards, stairs, open areas, roof tops, balcony etc.

checkpoint.name: PHC has demarcated space for keeping condemned junk material
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability of a demarcated & secured space for collecting and storing the junk material before its disposal

checkpoint.name: Walls are well-plastered and painted
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that wall (Internal and External) plaster is not chipped-off and the building is painted/ whitewashed in approved colour scheme. The paint has not faded away. 
Check for presence of any outdated posters & boards

checkpoint.name: Name of the PHC is prominently displayed at the entrance and have uniform signage system
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Name of the PHC is prominently displayed as per states policy.
The name board of the facility is well illuminated in night or is florescent.
Check All signage's (directional & departmental) are in local language and follow uniform colour scheme

checkpoint.name: Check if the facility has rain-water harvesting system
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for its functionality and storage system

checkpoint.name: Water supply system is maintained in the PHC
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check for leaking taps, pipes, over-flowing tanks and dysfunctional cisterns.
Over-head tank has functional float-valve.

checkpoint.name: No stray animals within the facility premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Observe for the presence of stray animals such as dogs, cats, cattle, pigs, etc. within the premises. Also discuss with the facility staff.
Check at the entrance of facility that cattle trap has been provided. Also look at the breach, if any, in the boundary wall

checkpoint.name: Pest Control Measures are implemented in the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the evidence at the facility ( Presence of Pests ,Record of Purchase of Pesticides and availability of the rat trap) and interview the staff

checkpoint.name: The Staff periodically sorts useful and unnecessary articles at work station
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask the staff, how frequently they sort and remove unnecessary articles from their work place like Nursing stations, work bench, dispensing counter in Pharmacy, etc.
Check for presence of unnecessary articles.

checkpoint.name: The Staff arranges the useful articles, records in systematic manner and label them
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if drugs, instruments, records are not lying in haphazard manner and kept near to point of use in systematic manner. The place has been demarcated for keeping different articles
Check that drugs, instruments, records, etc. are labelled for facilitating easy identification.

checkpoint.name: Front area/ Parks/ Open spaces are well maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that wild vegetation does not exist. Shrubs and Trees are well maintained. Over grown branches of plants/ tree have been trimmed regularly. Dry leaves and green waste are removed on daily basis.
Gardens/ green area are secured with fence

checkpoint.name: Internal Roads and pathways are uneven and clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that pathways, corridors, courtyards, etc. are clean and landscaped.

checkpoint.name: PHC has intact boundary wall and functional gates at entry
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that there is a proper boundary wall of adequate height without any breach. Wall is painted in uniform colour

checkpoint.name: PHC Infrastructure is well maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
No major cracks, seepage, chipped plaster & floors in the PHC. 
Periodic Maintenance is done.

checkpoint.name: Patients' furniture is in good condition
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that Patient beds, examination couch, stool, etc. are not rusted and are painted. Mattresses are clean and not torn
Trolleys, Stretchers, Wheel Chairs, etc. are well maintained( As applicable)

checkpoint.name: Window and doors are maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if Window panes are intact, and provided with Grill/ Wire Meshwork. Doors are intact and painted /varnished

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains/ Garbage in Toilets
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check the toilets randomly for any visible dirt, grease, stains, water accumulation in toilets
Check for any foul smell in the Toilets

checkpoint.name: Toilets have running water and functional cistern
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff to operate cistern and water taps

checkpoint.name: Ambulatory area are cleaned at least once in the day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day.

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ vegetation on walls and roof in Auxiliary area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that floors and walls of office, Meeting Room, Staff Room Record room etc. (As applicable) for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.
Check roof, walls, corners of these area for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, Vegetation, etc.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Detergent Disinfectant solution / Hospital Grade Phenyl for Cleaning purpose
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check for good quality PHC cleaning solution preferably a ISI mark. Composition and concentration of solution is written on label. 
Check with cleaning staff if they are getting adequate supply. Verify the consumption records.
Check, if the cleaning staff is aware of correct concentration and dilution method for preparing cleaning solution.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Cleaning Equipment
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the availability of mops, brooms, collection buckets etc. as per requirement.

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Vegetation/ Dust on the walls and roof in the Circulation area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that floors and walls of Corridors, Waiting area, stairs, roof top for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.
Check that roof, walls, corners of Corridors, Waiting area, stairs, roof top for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, etc.

checkpoint.name: Corridors are cleaned at least once in the day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day.

checkpoint.name: Procedure area are cleaned at least twice in a day
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day and also verify with check-list

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ vegetation's on walls and roof in Procedure area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that floors and walls of Procedure area like Labour Room, Dressing Room, Immunization Room etc. (As Applicable) for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.
Check that roof, walls, corners of these area for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, Vegetation, etc.

checkpoint.name: Lab and Pharmacy area are cleaned at least once in the day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day and also verify with check-list

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ Vegetation on walls and roof in Lab and Pharmacy area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that floors and walls of Lab and Pharmacy for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.
Check roof, walls, corners of these area for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, Vegetation, etc.

checkpoint.name: Periodic Monitoring of Housekeeping activities
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Periodic Monitoring is done by MOIC or another designated staff.

checkpoint.name: Use of Housekeeping Checklist
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that Housekeeping Checklist is displayed in PHC and updated. Check Housekeeping records if checklists are daily updated for at least last one month

checkpoint.name: No blocked/ over-flowing drains in the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Observe that the drains are not overflowing or blocked
All the drains are cleaned once in a week

checkpoint.name: Availability of connection with Municipal Sewage System/ or Soak Pit
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if PHC sewage has proper connection with municipal drainage system. 
If access to municipal system is not accessible, PHC should have a functional septic tank within the premises.

checkpoint.name: Use of Three bucket system for cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if cleaning staff uses three bucket system for cleaning. One bucket for Cleaning solution, second for plain water and third one for wringing the mop. Ask the cleaning staff about the process, Disinfection and washing of mops after every cleaning cycle

checkpoint.name: Use unidirectional method and out word mopping
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask cleaning staff to demonstrate the how they apply mop on floors. It should be in one direction without returning to the starting point. 
The mop should move from inner area to outer area of the room. Separate mop is used in the procedure area.

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ Vegetation's on walls and roof in OPD
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check floors and walls of the OPD for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.
Check that roof, walls, corners of OPD for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, vegetation, etc.

checkpoint.name: OPD are cleaned at least two in a day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day.

checkpoint.name: Segregation of BMW is done as per BMW management rule,2016
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that Soiled Waste is collected in the yellow bin & bag.
General & Biomedical Waste are not mixed together. 
Display of work instructions for segregation and handling of Biomedical waste

checkpoint.name: Check if the staff is aware of segregation protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about the segregation protocol (Red bag for re-cyclable, Glassware into Cardboard Box with blue marking, etc.)

checkpoint.name: The waste is transported in closed bag & trolley
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of trolley for transportation to collection point.

checkpoint.name: The PHC's waste is collected and transported by CWTF operator
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for records of linkage with CWTF operator or has functional deep burial pits within the facility.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Mercury Spill Management Kit and Staff is aware of Mercury Spill management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Mercury Spill Management Kit and ask staff what he/she would do in case of Mercury spill. (If facility is mercury free, give full compliance)

checkpoint.name: Disposal of hazardous chemicals
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Hazardous chemicals like Glutaraldehyde, Lab Reagents Should not be drained in sewage untreated

checkpoint.name: Dedicated Storage facility is available for biomedical waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if PHC has dedicated room for storage of Biomedical waste before disposal/handing over to Common Treatment Facility.

checkpoint.name: No Biomedical waste is stored for more than 48 Hours
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify that the waste is being disposed / handed over to CTF within 48 hour of generation. Check the record especially during holidays

checkpoint.name: Liquid waste is made safe before mixing with other waste water
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the procedure - staff interview and direct observation

checkpoint.name: The laboratory has a functional protocol for managing discarded samples
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: A copy of such protocol should be available and staff should be aware of the same.

checkpoint.name: Disposal of General Waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: There is a mechanism of removal of general waste from the facility and its disposal.

checkpoint.name: Innovations in managing general waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Look for efforts of the health facility in managing General Waste, such as Recycling of paper waste, vermicomposting, waste to energy initiative, etc.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Bins and plastic bags for segregation of waste at point of use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
One set of appropriate size bins at each point of generation for Biomedical and General waste.
Check all the bins are provided with chlorine free plastic bags. Ask staff about adequacy of supply.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Needle/ Hub cutter and puncture proof boxes
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: At each point of generation of sharp waste

checkpoint.name: PHC has a valid authorization for Bio Medical waste Management from the prescribed authority
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the validity of authorization certificate

checkpoint.name: PHC maintains records, as required under the Biomedical Waste Rules 2016
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check following records -
a. Annual report submission (before 30th June) 
b. Yearly Health Check-up record of all handlers
c. BMW training records of all staff (once in year training)
d. Immunisation records of all waste handlers

checkpoint.name: Sharp Waste is stored in Puncture proof containers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of Puncture & leak proof container (White Translucent) at point of use for storing needles, syringes with fixed needles, needles from cutter/burner, scalpel blade, etc.

checkpoint.name: Disinfection of Broken / Discarded Glassware is done as per recommended procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if such waste is either pre-treated with 10% Sodium Hypochlorite (having 30% residual chlorine) for 20 minutes or by autoclaving/ microwave/ hydroclave, followed storage in Blue Cardboard box for re-cycling.

checkpoint.name: PHC has adequate facility for disposal of Biomedical waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: The Health facility within 75 KM of CTF shall have a valid contract with a Common Treatment facility for disposal of Bio medical waste. Or else facility should have Deep Burial Pit and Sharp Pit within premises of Health facility. Such deep burial pit should have approval of the Prescribed Authority and would meet the norms.

checkpoint.name: Facility manages recyclable waste as per approved procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check management of IV Bottles (Plastic), IV tubes, Urine Bags, Syringes, Catheter, etc.
(Autoclaving/ Microwaving/ Hydroclaving followed by shredding or a combination of sterilisation and shredding. Later treated waste is handed over to registered vendors.)

checkpoint.name: Staff is adheres to hand washing protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check Display of Hand washing Instructions
Ask facility staff to demonstrate 6 steps of normal hand wash and 5 moments of hand washing

checkpoint.name: Availability of Sink and running water at point of use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for washbasin with functional tap, soap and running water at all points of use

checkpoint.name: Decontamination of instruments and Surfaces like examination table, dressing tables etc.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check whether instruments are decontaminated with 0.5% chlorine solution for 10 minutes. Check instruments are cleaned thoroughly with water and soap before sterilization
Ask staff when and how they clean the surfaces either by chlorine solution or Disinfectant like carbolic acid

checkpoint.name: Staff knows how to make Chlorine solution
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the staff about the procedure of making chlorine solution and its frequency

checkpoint.name: Antibiotic Policy is implemented at the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if the PHC has documented Anti biotic policy and doctors are aware of it.

checkpoint.name: Immunization and medical check-up of Service Providers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
PHC staff has been immunized against Hepatitis B
Check for the records and lab investigations of staff

checkpoint.name: Facility measures the Health care associated infections
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for monitoring of Healthcare Associated Infection that may occur in a Primary healthcare setting like Injection abscess, Postpartum sepsis, infection at dressing and suturing sites etc.

checkpoint.name: Facility reports all notifiable diseases and events
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check facility has list of all notifiable disease needs immediate/periodic reporting to higher authority.
Check records that notifiable disease have been reported in program such as IDSP and AEFI Surveillance.

checkpoint.name: Adherence to Protocol for High Level disinfection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with the staff process about of High Level disinfection using Boiling for 20 minutes with lid on, soaking in 2% Glutaraldehyde/Chlorine solution for 20 minutes.

checkpoint.name: Adherence to Protocols for sterilization
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check about awareness of recommended temperature, duration and pressure for autoclaving instruments - 121 degree C, 15 Pound Pressure for 20 Minutes (30 Minutes if wrapped) Linen - 121 C, 15 Pound for 30 Minutes.
Check if the staff know the protocol for sterilization of laparoscope soaking it in 2% Glutaraldehyde solution for 10 Hours

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of how to manage spills
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for adherence to protocols

checkpoint.name: Spill management protocols are displayed at points if use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for display

checkpoint.name: Cross-ventilation
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of Fans/ air conditioning/ Heating/ exhaust/ Ventilators as per environment condition and requirement

checkpoint.name: Preventive measures for air borne infections has been taken
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff is aware, adhere and promote respiratory hygiene and cough etiquettes

checkpoint.name: Use of Masks ,Head cap and Lab coat, Apron etc.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if staff uses mask head caps , Lab coat and aprons as applicable

checkpoint.name: Use of Gloves during procedures and examination
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the staff uses gloves during examination, and while conducting procedures

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware about Standard Precautions
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about Standard precautions and how they adhere to it.

checkpoint.name: Infectious patients are separated from other patients
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check patients with respiratory infectious cases are separated from general patients in OPD area

checkpoint.name: No re-use of disposable personal protective equipment
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that disposable gloves and mask are not re-used. Reusable Gloves and mask are used after adequate sterilization.

checkpoint.name: The staff is aware of use of gloves, when to use (occasion) and its type
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with the staff when do they wear gloves, and when gloves are not required. The Staff should also know difference between clean & sterilized gloves and when to use

checkpoint.name: Arrangements for washing linens
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check facility has in-house or outsourced arrangements for washing linens at least once in a week.

checkpoint.name: Available linens are clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check linen such as table cloth, bedsheets, curtains etc. are clean and spotless

checkpoint.name: Medicines are arranged systematically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check all the shelves/racks containing medicines are labelled in pharmacy and drug store
Heavy items are stored at lower shelves/racks
Fragile items are not stored at the edges of the shelves
Drugs and consumables are stored away from water and sources of heat, direct sunlight etc.
Drugs are not stored at floor and adjacent to wall

checkpoint.name: Cold storage equipment's are clean and managed properly
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check ILR, Deep freezers, Refrigerators and Ice packs are clean
Check if there is a practice of regular cleaning.
Cold storage equipment are not been used for purpose other than storing drugs and vaccines.

checkpoint.name: Presence of security Guard
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the presence of at least one security personnel at PHC

checkpoint.name: Departments are locked after working hours
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Departments like OPD, Lab, Administrative office etc. are locked after working hours.

checkpoint.name: The facility receives adequate quantity of water as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Water is available on 24x7 basis at all points of usage

checkpoint.name: There is storage tank for the water and tank is cleaned periodically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: The PHC should have capacity to store 48 hours water requirement Water tank is cleaned at six monthly interval and records are maintained.

checkpoint.name: Biomedical waste generated during outreach session are transported to the PHC on the same day
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the records and ask staff

checkpoint.name: Medical officers monitor cleanliness and hygiene of outreach sessions and sub centres.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with medical officers and records of monthly meeting ''swachh bharat abhiyan'' has been followed up during monthly meetings with extension workers like MPW, ASHA, ANM etc.

checkpoint.name: IEC regarding Swachhta Abhiyan is displayed within the facilities premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Should be displayed prominently in local language

checkpoint.name: IEC regarding importance of Hygiene practices are displayed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check IEC regarding hand washing, water sanitation, use of toilets are displayed in local language

checkpoint.name: Roles and responsibility of different staff members have been assigned and communicated
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask different members about their roles and responsibilities

checkpoint.name: Cleanliness and infection control committee has been constituted
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with the records

checkpoint.name: There is a regular monitoring of hygiene of staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check about personal hygiene and clean dress of staff

checkpoint.name: PHC has dress code policy for all cadre of staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
PHCs staff adhere to dress code
Check Identity cards and name plates have been provided to all staff

checkpoint.name: Bio medical waste Management training has been provided to the staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with the training records

checkpoint.name: Infection control Training has been provided to the staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff are trained at the time of induction and once in every year

checkpoint.name: Patients are made aware of their responsibility of keeping the health facility clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask patients about their roles& responsibilities with regards to cleanliness. Patients responsibilities should be prominently displayed

checkpoint.name: The Health facility has a system to take feed-back from patients and visitors for maintaining the cleanliness of the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if there is a feedback system for the patients. Verify the records

checkpoint.name: Availability of point of care diagnostic test
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Glucometer, RDK , Blood grouping

checkpoint.name: Availability of New born resuscitation& essential new born care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Dedicated Functional New born Care services in Operation theatre

checkpoint.name: Availability of Elective C-section services
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check services are available and are being utilized

checkpoint.name: Management of MTP
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Surgical management

checkpoint.name: Availability of Emergency C-section services
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check services are available and are being utilized

checkpoint.name: Availability of Post partum sterilization services
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: tubal ligation

checkpoint.name: OT Services are available 24X7
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with OT records that OT services were functional in 24X7 and surgeries are being conducted in night hours

checkpoint.name: Availability of Emergency OT services as and when required
Availability of Maternity HDU/ICU services in the facility
Separate consent is taken for Anesthesia procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: written consent with details of the anaesthesia with potentials risks and complication. Should be signed by patient/next of kin and one witness

checkpoint.name: Consent is taken for surgical procedures
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: written consent with details of the procedure with potentials risks and complication. Should be signed by patient/next of kin and one witness

checkpoint.name: Information regarding services are displayed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Display doctor/ Nurse on duty and updated OT schedule displayed

checkpoint.name: Availability of departmental signage's
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Numbering, main department and internal sectional signage, Restricted area signage displayed. Directional signages are given from the entry of the facility

checkpoint.name: All surgical procedure are free of cost for JSSK beneficiaries
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: free drugs, consumables , blood, referral etc.

checkpoint.name: Patient Records are kept at secure place beyond access to general staff/visitors
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: In drawers/Amirah; preferably with lock facility.

checkpoint.name: Visual Privacy is maintained between two OT Tables
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Preferably only one OT table should be placed in theatre, if it is not possible because of high case load adequate visual privacy should be provided through screens of multiple patients are present in same OT

checkpoint.name: Patients are properly draped/covered before and after procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Look patients are covered while transferred from ward to OT and vice-versa.

checkpoint.name: Pregnant women is not left unattended or ignored during care in the OT
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that care providers are attentive and empathetic to the pregnant women at no point of care they are left alone.

checkpoint.name: Behaviour of OT staff is dignified and respectful
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that OT staff is not providing care in undignified manner such as yelling, scolding , shouting, blaming and using abusive language

checkpoint.name: OT is easily accessible
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Availability of Wheel chair or stretcher for easy Access. Door is wide enough for passage of trolley and staff.

checkpoint.name: Non structural components are properly secured
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for fixtures and furniture like cupboards, cabinets, and heavy equipment , hanging objects are properly fastened and secured

checkpoint.name: Windows/ ventilators if any in the OT are intact and sealed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: No broken glass, gap or cracks in window/ventilator.

checkpoint.name: Walls and floor of the OT covered with joint less tiles
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: made of anti-skid & Epoxy flooring

checkpoint.name: Availability of three phase electricity supply
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check electricity bill or Power Distribution Board. Meter have three wires coming out (with one neutral).

checkpoint.name: OT does not have temporary connections and loosely hanging wires
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: No extension cord or multi-plugs

checkpoint.name: Unidirectional flow of goods and services
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Services are designed in a way, that there is no criss cross in moment of sterile & no sterile supplies & equipment etc.

checkpoint.name: Corridors are wide enough for movement of trolleys
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: 7 to 10 feet.

checkpoint.name: Adequate space for accommodating surgical load
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: OT around 40 Square meter. Two OT tables are not kept in one OT

checkpoint.name: OT tables are available as per load
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Hydraulic OT Tables 
As per case load at least two

checkpoint.name: Demarcated sterile Zone
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Operating room, Scrub station, Anesthesia station,

checkpoint.name: Availability of Scrub Area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Height around 96 cm with elbow taps/sensors, both hot and cold water available. Sink is deep and wide enough to avoid spoiling. Scrub area should not be inside the OT room.
